doc.previous: These direct tripartite and transitive are all quite rare The alignment types other than Austronesian can be shown graphically like this
doc.after: In addition in some languages both nominative accusative and ergative absolutive systems may be used split between different grammatical contexts This is called split ergativity The split may sometimes be linked to animacy as in many Australian Aboriginal languages or to aspect as in Mayan languages A few Australian languages such as Diyari are split between accusative ergative and tripartite alignment depending on animacy
